timeline.message:
DEV-1250 Register CRAMs with API

Allow calling of arbitrary API endpoints after files have been created
so that we can add additional metadata for certain files from the run.

timeline.bodyText:
singleton anti-pattern. makes the class impossible to unit test. let's invert the dependency and make AdditionalApiCalls a field.
Also I was thinking we'd use the "ReportComponents" for this rather than introducing a new class in which to register them.
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

replies.bodyText:
Meant to mention - this is absolutely just a waypoint, it won't be staying that way, working on getting rid of it now.
I was sitting on the fence with putting it in the ReportComponents, wasn't sure about overloading but am happy to make that change.
replies.author: nedleitch

timeline.bodyText: another side-effect of singleton. Why isn't register modelled as an Operation somehow?
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

timeline.bodyText: I like the thought behind this but feel like it introduces inconsistency to only have ApiFile operation and no similar abstractions for other operations.
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

timeline.bodyText: They also don't do much... maybe you can get away with just a BiFunction where you need the abstraction?
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

timeline.bodyText: empty constructor and non-final mutable field? looks like a job for immutables
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

replies.bodyText: Indeed. Was actually looking for a way to inline it but will switch to an Immutable.
replies.author: nedleitch

timeline.message: DEV-1250 Move additional file ops to StageOutput
DEV-1250 Move completion steps up to FullPipeline
